description: From Latin septuāgēnārius (“containing 70”) either directly or via French septuagénaire, from Latin septuāgēnī (“70 each”) + -ārius (“-ary”), from septuāgintā (“seven tens, 70”). Cognate with septuagenarian.

definitionGroups.group: (now rare) Of or related to the number seventy, particularly

entries.meaning: Synonym of septuagenarian: lasting or aged seventy years; seventy-year-old.
(now rare) Synonym of septuagenarian: a seventy-year-old.
